The provided chunk defines regular expression patterns (`at_c_at_p_pattern` and `method_class_ref_pattern`) used for parsing and extracting specific information from docstrings or text. These regex patterns help identify annotations (e.g., `@c`, `@p`) and method or class references in formatted strings, which is crucial for processing documentation or code analysis tasks.

Context: This chunk is part of a larger script that processes and documents code, such as generating API references or handling autodoc functionality. The regex patterns are used to extract specific annotations and method/class references from docstrings or other text inputs, aiding in the automation of documentation generation or code analysis.

# Regex patterns.
at_c_at_p_pattern = re.compile(r'@[cp]\s+([^\s]+)')
method_class_ref_pattern = re.compile(r'([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)\(\)|([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*::[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)(\(\))?|([a-zA-Z_]+[A-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_.:]*)(\(\))?')
